Journalist Christopher Cadelago, in an article published by Politico on March 4, describes what it is like to be a pro-Biden Democrat who lives in a rural area and is surrounded by Trump supporters.
“Blue-collar ‘diner stories’ about disaffected Democrats and independents who crossed over to support Republicans are so common they’ve become their own media subgenre,” Cadelago explains.
When Democrat Joe Biden enjoyed a decisive victory over Republican Donald Trump in the 2020 presidential election, he did so with a lot of help from urban and suburban voters.
One of the Democrats Politico interviewed was Joanne Fitzpatrick, who lives in the small town of DuBois in rural Clearfield County, Pennsylvania.
It gets to a point where you avoid going somewhere that you know some of your friends are on the Republican side.
